result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad A. Welsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Court appoints Attorney Peter Masana @$65/hr @ $35.00/month commencing 6/26/17

Defendant Brad A. Welsch appeared by phone means with Attorney Andrew I. Martinez. Prosecuting Atty Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Motion to withdraw counsel.  Defendant wants Court to appoint new counsel.  Court inquiries about if there is an active victim in this case.  Atty. Martinez was court appointed. Atty. Ryan prefers to go forward and not postpone trial, no reason for delay.  Court not postpone trial.  Court not going to grant motion to withdraw at this time. Court would like written request from DE and Atty. Martinez about withdraw by Monday 6/12/17.  Atty. Ryan makes statement on other charges in other counties.  DE would like this matter done as soon as possible.  Court will now grant motion to withdraw.  Court appoints Atty. Masana and gives phone # to defendant.
Motion hearing on June 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  (Manually wrote on defendant's notice "DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED TO APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THE MOTION HEARING ON THE DATE & TIME NOTICED ABOVE.")
to Withdraw

records.addlTxt: Return date at 02-22-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Brad A. Welsch in court.  Court questions DE on income/assets.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Andrew Martinez (144 4th Ave Ste #2, Baraboo 355-2000).  RD reset.  Bond continued.  DE to reimburse COC's office $35/month beginning on or before 2/26/2016 and then by the 26th of each month thereafter.  Return date scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brad A. Welsch in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant recv'd and waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney, waived today only.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
